alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; New Kent; Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 9:10PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern New Kent, east central Henrico, southeastern Hanover and south central King William Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 910 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Highland Springs, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bottoms Bridge around 915 PM EDT. Talleysville and Tunstall around 925 PM EDT. King William around 935 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Richmond International, Quinton, Fair Oaks, Lanesville, Browns Corner, Palls, Cooke, Orapax Farms, Cohoke and Sandston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; New Kent; Western King William
